definition: to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: A year later, my cruel and desperate for your story.
sentences.chinese: 壹年後，我的殘忍加你的絕情讓故事落幕。

sentences.english: A woman once unfeeling, more destructive than the atomic bomb.
sentences.chinese: 女人一旦絕情，比原子彈更具有摧毀性。

sentences.english: Perhaps some people will say that like this too the unfeeling, a face did not give.
sentences.chinese: 或許有人會說，這樣太絕情了吧，一點面子都不給。

sentences.english: I can be more unfeeling unfeeling than anyone.
sentences.chinese: 絕情起來我可以比任何人更絕情。

sentences.english: I can be more unfeeling unfeeling than anyone.
sentences.chinese: 絕情起來我可以比任何人更絕情。

sentences.english: My life has been doped Desperate your lightning power split, and Lou Lou injured.
sentences.chinese: 我的生命摻遭你絕情雷擊電劈，而婁婁受傷。

sentences.english: Yesterday John received a Dear John letter and a pink slip almost at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 昨日，約翰幾乎同時收到一封絕情信和一份解僱通知。

sentences.english: Thank you for your unfeeling, Let me learn to give up.
sentences.chinese: 多謝你的絕情，讓我學會斷念。

sentences.english: Thank you for your unfeeling, let me learn to give up.
sentences.chinese: 多謝你的絕情，讓我學會了死心。

sentences.english: Do you see the cold unfeeling, I say not to export.
sentences.chinese: 做給你看的冷漠絕情，是我說不出口的心痛。

definition: to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
hard to deal with/hard to get along with
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
lit. seeming neither close nor distant (idiom)/fig. to keep one's distance/(of a relationship) lukewarm/vague
to be in a tangle/to nag
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
